official-title.#text: To provide for access to health insurance coverage of life-sustaining treatments furnished by certain providers.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

header.#text: Providing for access to health insurance coverage of life-sustaining treatments furnished by certain providers

continuation-text.#text: the individual may enroll in health insurance coverage offered in any other State, which provides for coverage of such operation by such provider, as if such individual were a resident of such other State.

text.#text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, in the case of an individual who resides in a State and who as of December 31 of a year had in effect health insurance coverage that provided benefits for a life-sustaining treatment, with respect to a health condition of such individual, furnished by a provider that before such date furnished one or more services to such individual related to such condition, if—
such coverage for such individual is not continued for the plan year beginning after such date; and
there is no health insurance coverage offered in such State that provides for coverage of such life-saving treatment by such provider;

term.#tail: means, with respect to an individual, any medical device or procedure, including a drug, ventilator, surgery, therapy, or artificially provided fluids and nutrients, that, as certified by the health care provider of such individual, is required to increase life expectancy of such individual by restoring or taking over a vital bodily function.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 3621 IH: To provide for access to health insurance coverage of life-sustaining treatments furnished by certain providers.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}rights.#text: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
